title: List of Scripps National Spelling Bee champions
summary: The Scripps National Spelling Bee (formerly the Scripps Howard National Spelling Bee and commonly called the National Spelling Bee) is an annual spelling bee held in the United States.  The competition began in 1925,[1] and was initially organized by The Courier-Journal of Louisville, Kentucky, until the Scripps Howard Broadcasting Company (now the E. W. Scripps Company) assumed sponsorship in 1941.  Every speller in the competition has previously participated in a local spelling bee, usually organized by a local newspaper.[2]
